abstract: Controversial Kenyan aristocrat Thomas Patrick Gilbert Cholmondeley dies of heart attack while undergoing hip-replacement surgery; passionate conservationist who served three years in prison for manslaughter was polarizing figure in country, where his powerful British family settled more than century ago.

headline.print_headline: A Kenyan Revered and Reviled Dies After Surgery
headline.main: Thomas Cholmondeley, Scion Implicated in Killings of 2 Kenyans, Dies at 48

snippet: A descendant of British settlers, Mr. Cholmondeley was known as an eccentric outdoorsman who liked fast horses, speedy bikes and guns. He had been hospitalized for hip-replacement surgery....
lead_paragraph: A descendant of British settlers, Mr. Cholmondeley was known as an eccentric outdoorsman who liked fast horses, speedy bikes and guns. He had been hospitalized for hip-replacement surgery.
